data.title: KapKap Secures $10 Million in Funding Led by Animoca Brands
data.description:
According to Foresight News, AI-native Web3 platform KapKap has successfully raised $10 million in funding. The seed round was led by Animoca Brands, with participation from Shima Capital, Mechanism Capital, Klaytn Foundation, and Big Brain Holdings. Additionally, the strategic round was led by Unicorn Verse, with contributions from Rzong Capital and BGX Capital.

KapKap is a platform that transforms players' attention and reputation into digital value.

data.title: Polymarket TVL Surpasses $245 Million with Significant Growth
data.description: According to BlockBeats, data from DefiLlama indicates that Polymarket's total value locked (TVL) has exceeded $245 million, reaching $245.2 million. This marks a 43% increase over the past month.

data.title: Alleged Ukrainian fraudster extradited to US over $500K Conti ransomware plot
data.description:
Oleksii Oleksiyovych Lytvynenko was extradited from Ireland to the US for allegedly using Conti to extort $500K from victims in Tennessee.
source: https://protos.com/alleged-ukrainian-fraudster-extradited-to-us-over-500k-conti-ransomware-plot/

data.title: Morgan Stanley: Gold prices could rise to $4,500 by mid-2026
data.description: Morgan Stanley said on Friday that gold prices are on track to rise to $4,500 an ounce by mid-2026 (previously projected to reach $4,500 in the second half of 2026) due to strong physical demand from ETFs and central banks, as well as continued uncertainty about the economic outlook. In a report, Morgan Stanley noted, "Recent gold price movements have pushed it into 'overbought' territory on the Relative Strength Index (RSI), but the recent pullback has brought it back to healthier levels, potentially clearing market positions." The bank expects continued buying of gold ETFs as interest rates decline, along with continued central bank purchases, albeit at a slower pace, while jewelry demand is expected to stabilize. However, Morgan Stanley also warned of downside risks, including potential price volatility that could prompt investors to shift to other asset classes, or central banks deciding to reduce their gold reserves. (Jinshi)

data.title: Tether's net profit exceeded $10 billion in the first three quarters, and the circulating supply of USDT reached $174 billion.
data.description: According to Tether's official website, Tether International released its Q3 2025 audit report: net profit exceeded $10 billion for the year, USD₮ increased by $17 billion this quarter, and the circulating supply reached $174 billion; the company's holdings of US Treasury bonds were approximately $135 billion, ranking 17th globally. As of September 30, reserve assets were $1,812.231 billion, liabilities were $1,744.454 billion, and excess reserves were $6.778 billion; holdings of gold were $12.9 billion and Bitcoin were $9.9 billion (approximately 13% of reserves). Tether completed the Celsius lawsuit settlement with its own funds and applied for a private alternative investment fund license in El Salvador.

data.title: Shiba Inu (SHIB) Chart Exposes Brutal Truth About Cryptocurrency Market, Analyst Warns
data.description:
Shiba Inu (SHIB) has lost almost 80% since its 2024 peak, and a new chart from IncomeSharks lays it bare: one month of hype, nearly two years of collapse and no sign of a rebound.
source: https://u.today/shiba-inu-shib-chart-exposes-brutal-truth-about-cryptocurrency-market-analyst-warns
